answers.answer: Yes, fatty liver is something that diet and exercise program can often help resolve. I'm sure your specialist will be more helpful as they will have your full medical charts in front of them. Most of us here are patients, not doctors. Frankly, I wouldn't get too worried at this point and just wait to see what the specialist has to say.-- Jim

My mother has fatty liver disease (no Hep at all); she's been about 30 lbs overweight for about 25 years.  Her doctor didn't even recommend any changes to her diet, or exercise, or any of that.  I guess as long as your bloodwork is okay & you don't have any serious diseases or side effects, fatty liver isn't anything to be too too concerned about.

They did a hep. panel blood test for you in the ER?? what state do you live in? That is a more comprehensive test that ER's normally don't do. Are you sure they tested you for hep? Always prepare for the worst and hope for the best. Good luck

question: I am a 34 year old male, 6'0", weighing 280.  I recently went to the ER with abdominal pain and bloating. My blood work (cholesterol, diabetes, etc. levels were normal - hepatitus tests negative but AST level was 34 and ALT level 74. A cat scan indicated fatty liver tissue disease. Now we are being refererred to a specialist but can not be seen until March 26th. The local rural doctor said to prepare for the worst. What is next for us? Or is this something that diet and excercise can resolve.
title: High ALT Levels - Liver
